'''''Amon Hen'' 4''' is the fourth issue of the [[Amon Hen (journal)|''Amon Hen'' journal]] by [[The Tolkien Society]].

==Contents==
: ''All content is by John Martin unless indicated otherwise.
* "Greater loves hath this man; editorial excuses"
* Report on annual meeting of the Tolkien Society (includes a letter from Joy Chant)
* News
** Injunction against pirated edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' (by Jessica Kemball-Cook)
** Ill health of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] (from a ''Times'' article)
** Production of [[The Hobbit (1977 film)|an adaptation of ''The Hobbit'']] by Rankin and Bass (by Jim Allan)
** Call for volunteers for the Mythopoeic Linguistic Fellowship's Tolkien linguistic commentary (by Jim Allan)
* "Howard Rosenblum - member representative - makes a partisan announcement"
* "John Martin, representing himself, makes suggestions, sweety"
* "''[[Mallorn (journal)|Mallorn]]'' - or a day in the death of a literary journal"
* "The Mailman Cometh": letters from Pat McIntosh (Firiel), John Abbott, Sylvia Blundel, Jon Harvey, Dave Weldrake, Colin Dean, A.J. Baker, Grahame Lamb, and Roger Johnson
* "Other news for ''Amon Hen''" by Jessica Kemball-Cook
* "Report of the meeting of the Northfarthing Smial" by Jessica Kemball-Cook
* Announcement of InnMoot by [[Vera Chapman]] (Belladonna Took)
* Letter from Tony Fallone
* Books
** "Books to borrow" by Peter Herring
** ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien (Writers for the 70's)]]'' by [[Robley Evans]] (reviewed by Jim Allan)
** ''The Wolves of Willoughby Chase'' / ''Black Hearts in Battersea'' / ''Nightbirds on Nantucket'' by Joan Aiken (reviewed by Pat McIntosh)
* "Current magazines"
* "The Library" (announcement of Tolkien Society library)
* New members and changes of address
* "Message in parting, a resigned farewell and ultimatum"
